scenarioDescription:
The K2-228 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-228 is a star with 0.71 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.65 times its radius. It is located 422.24 light years away from the solar system.

K2-228 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-228 system


K2-228 b

K2-228 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-228 b is 1.927 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-228 b is 1.210 that of Earth. At 1.927 Earth masses, K2-228 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-228, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-228 - System With 1 Exoplanet
